snippet: A proposal to set a quota for female candidates on party parliamentary slates is being linked to the economic mess that a largely male leadership led the country into, reports Didi Kirsten Tatlow in her Page Two column.
abstract: A proposal to set a quota for female candidates on party parliamentary slates is being linked to the economic mess that a largely male leadership led the country into, reports Didi Kirsten Tatlow in her Page Two column.
lead_paragraph: CORK, Ireland - Since the economic meltdown that began in 2009 with the bursting of the Irish property bubble, unemployment has risen to more than 14 percent and the national debt to €120 billion, or $159 billion - an almost cartoonishly large sum for a nation of 4.6 million people.
